newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks close up on institutional buying.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks close up on institutional buying.

text.p: Bangladesh stocks closed marginally higher thanks to buying by state-owned institutional investor Investment Corporation of Bangladesh, brokers said.
The Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) all-share price index gained 2.24 points or 0.29 percent to close at 1,113.9 on a turnover of 34.1 million taka. Of 100 traded issues 47 gained and 48 lost.
The market will be closed for three days for the Moslem Eid al-Adha festival, beginning on Thursday.
"Small investors were inactive or sold to cash in before the Eid," said one broker. Apex Foods rose 20 taka to 1,893, Olympic Industries gained 7.16 to 689.82, but ACI fell 1.7 to 130.62.
